attributes.action: Delay IR35 changes until after the Pandemic & Stock Market crash
attributes.additional_details: Because it's placing a huge strain on contractors who don't get the benefits that employees receive during this pandemic such as sick pay. Contractors literally cannot afford to not work.
attributes.background: Contractors are facing a huge challenge preparing for IR35 in the wake of the Pandemic, Work from home and self isolation advice, with extra strain on those with a hand in the stock markets. Equally, companies are distracted from preparing themselves for IR35.

rejection.details:
On 17 March 2020 the Government announced that it was postponing the reforms to the off-payroll working rules IR35 from April 2020 to 6 April 2021.

https://hansard.parliament.uk/Commons/2020-03-17/debates/9038AB35-B474-48EC-83EC-A1CA7347043A/IncomeTax(Charge)#contribution-4C019642-2598-4500-A5EE-2942C2DDCFB4

We have published a petition calling for the Government to revoke IR35 legislation, which you might be interested in: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300458
